sentence: She ___ (write) a letter at this moment.

rule: Present Perfect Negative (have/has + not + past participle)

sentence: She ___ (wait) for us when we arrived.

rule: Present Continuous used for immediate reaction

sentence: By next year, he ___ (complete) his degree.
If I ___ (know) the truth, I would have told you.
rule: Third Conditional (If + Past Perfect, would have + past participle)
Past Simple Negative (did not + base form)

sentence: One of the boys ___ (be) absent today.
rule: One of + plural noun = Singular Verb
Distance/Money/Time as a unit = Singular Verb

sentence: While I ___ (walk) in the garden, a snake bit me.
He talks as if he ___ (know) everything.
It is many years since I ___ (meet) you.
rule: Since preceded by Present Tense takes Past Simple

sentence: It was long since I ___ (see) her.
rule: Since preceded by Past Tense takes Past Perfect

sentence: I saw him ___ (go) to the market.
If I were a king, I ___ (help) the poor.
rule: Second Conditional (If + Past Simple, would + base form)

sentence: Had I been rich, I ___ (buy) a car.
The patient died after the doctor ___ (come).
rule: Past Perfect happens before Past Simple (After + Past Perfect)

sentence: The patient had died before the doctor ___ (come).
He used to ___ (walk) in the morning.
It is high time we ___ (change) our bad habits.
rule: It is high time + Past Simple

sentence: Bread and butter ___ (be) my favorite breakfast.
rule: Pair nouns expressing one idea = Singular Verb

sentence: There ___ (be) a high school in our village.
rule: ‘There’ takes verb according to the following subject (a high school)

sentence: There ___ (be) two primary schools in our area.
rule: ‘There’ takes verb according to the following subject (two schools)

sentence: Don't disturb me, I ___ (do) my homework.
rule: Action happening right now = Present Continuous

sentence: Have you ever ___ (be) to Cox's Bazar?
No sooner had he seen the police than he ___ (run) away.
Scarcely had we reached the station when the train ___ (leave).
I looking forward to ___ (hear) from you.
English is ___ (speak) all over the world.
Romeo and Juliet ___ (be) written by Shakespeare.
rule: Name of a book = Singular Verb
The poor (class of people) = Plural Verb
Names of subjects ending in 's' are Singular

sentence: Neither he nor his brothers ___ (be) present.
rule: Neither/nor takes verb matching the second subject (brothers)
Either/or takes verb matching the second subject (I)
Many a + singular noun = Singular Verb

sentence: It is time we ___ (start) the work.
rule: It is time (with subject) + Past Simple

sentence: It is time to ___ (leave) the place.
rule: It is time (without subject) + to + base form

sentence: He speaks as though he ___ (be) a madman.
Ten years ___ (pass) since I met you.
Having ___ (do) the work, he went home.
To ___ (tell) the truth, he is honest.
I went to the library with a view to ___ (read).
He went to market to ___ (buy) a shirt.
Five years passed since his father ___ (die).

rule: One person (The + noun + and + noun) = Singular

sentence: The headmaster and the secretary ___ (be) present.
rule: Two people (The + noun + and + the + noun) = Plural

sentence: Each of the boys ___ (get) a prize.

rule: Proverb / Relative pronoun 'that' refers to 'All' (singular sense)

sentence: The color of his eyes ___ (be) blue.
The players in the field ___ (be) tired.

rule: Present Perfect Continuous (action started in past, still continuing)

sentence: If I had seen him, I ___ (tell) him the news.
Had I known it before, I ___ (not/do) it.
A song is being ___ (sing) by her.
English is ___ (speak) all over the world.
I get the letter ___ (write) by him.
He ran fast lest he ___ (miss) the train.
We suspect him to ___ (be) a thief.
The committee ___ (be) divided in their opinion.
The jury ___ (be) unanimous in its decision.
rule: Collective noun acting as one = Singular

sentence: If I ___ (be) you, I would accept the offer.
He behaves as if he ___ (own) the house.
The scenery of Cox's Bazar ___ (be) charming.
Neither the chairman nor the members ___ (be) present.
The girl with her sisters ___ (be) coming.
rule: Subject 'The girl' is main (ignore 'with her sisters')

sentence: The box, including all the contents, ___ (be) stolen.
Mr. Rahman, accompanied by his wife, ___ (be) here.
rule: Accompanied by doesn't change number of subject

sentence: He ___ (lay) the book on the table.
I ___ (hang) the picture on the wall.
I ___ (have) my breakfast when he came.

rule: Present Perfect (have auxiliary + had main verb)

sentence: If you play in the rain, you might ___ (catch) cold.
The man appears to have ___ (be) rich.
The baby is too weak to ___ (walk).
He is so weak that he cannot ___ (walk).
Many a man ___ (be) present at the meeting.
rule: Many a + singular noun = Singular Verb
More than one + noun = Singular Verb
Fraction of singular mass noun = Singular
Collective noun as single unit = Singular

sentence: If you ___ (inform) me earlier, I could have helped you.
rule: Third conditional: If + past perfect, could have + past participle.

sentence: She said she ___ (finish) the work by the next day.
rule: Reported speech: future -> would + base form.

sentence: I ___ (not see) him since we left school in 2019.
rule: Present perfect: since + point of time.

sentence: The match ___ (stop) due to heavy rain yesterday.
rule: Past simple passive voice: was/were + past participle.
Subjunctive mood: use 'were' with wish (unreal situation).

sentence: By this time next year, they ___ (move) to Canada.
rule: Future perfect: will have + past participle.

sentence: I ___ (live) here while my house was being built.
She ___ (study) medicine before she switched to engineering.
rule: Past perfect for an earlier past action.

sentence: You ___ (not cross) the road when the light is red.
rule: Strong obligation/prohibition: must not + base form.

sentence: He acts as if he ___ (know) everything.
rule: Unreal comparison with 'as if': past simple.

sentence: Neither of the boys ___ (do) their homework correctly.
rule: Neither takes singular verb: has done.

sentence: I ___ (walk) for two hours when it suddenly started raining.
rule: Past perfect continuous: had been + ing.

sentence: The teacher made them ___ (write) the answer again.

rule: Present perfect continuous: since + point of time.

sentence: He ___ (not play) football when I saw him.
She would rather ___ (stay) home than go outside.
rule: Would rather + base form of verb.

sentence: I ___ (meet) him once before, but I forget where.
They ___ (not allow) us to enter the hall.
rule: Simple past negative: did not + base form.

sentence: He said that he ___ (come) the next day.
rule: Reported speech: future -> would + base form.

sentence: The train ___ (leave) by the time we reached the station.
She ___ (sleep) for an hour when the phone rang.
It’s high time you ___ (start) studying seriously.
They ___ (discuss) the issue when the manager entered.
rule: Past continuous: ongoing past action interrupted.
Future passive: will be + past participle.

sentence: She ___ (not tell) me that she was leaving.
rule: Past simple negative: did not + base form.

sentence: He ___ (be) able to solve it if he tried.
I ___ (never see) such a beautiful sunset before.
By the time you arrive, I ___ (finish) my homework.
The jury ___ (be) divided in their opinions.
He went to the library with a view to ___ (read).
The headmaster and the secretary ___ (be) coming.
rule: Two different persons (The + Noun + and + The + Noun) = Plural
Same person (The + Noun + and + Noun) = Singular

sentence: I got the letter ___ (open) by him.
It is I who ___ (be) to blame.
Fifty thousand taka ___ (be) a good amount.
rule: Amount of money considered as one unit = Singular

sentence: If I had a typewriter, I ___ (type) myself.
He talks as if he ___ (be) the leader.
Each boy and each girl ___ (have) a pen.

rule: Neither of + plural noun = Singular Verb

sentence: The bed feels soft when it is ___ (touch).
We look forward to ___ (receive) a reply.
It is high time we ___ (protect) our environment.
rule: It is high time + Past Simple

sentence: Five years have passed since I ___ (see) you.
It was long since we ___ (meet) last.
No sooner had the teacher entered than the students ___ (stand) up.
Hardly had I reached the station when the train ___ (leave).
While ___ (cross) the road, a car hit him.
While he ___ (walk) in the garden, he saw a snake.
The United States ___ (have) a big army.
One of my friends ___ (be) a lawyer.
rule: One of + plural noun = Singular verb
Passive Voice (Mob treated as singular unit here)

sentence: Bread and butter ___ (be) his only food.

rule: Help takes bare infinitive (verb without to)
Introductory 'There' takes verb from following subject (a king)

sentence: There ___ (be) many stars in the sky.
rule: Introductory 'There' takes verb from following subject (many stars)

sentence: If it ___ (rain), I will not go.
If I ___ (know) his number, I would call him.
If I had seen him, I ___ (give) him the message.
Had I been a bird, I ___ (fly).
He used to ___ (swim) in the river.
Don't make a noise while your father ___ (sleep).
He ___ (suffer) from fever for a week.
The baby ___ (cry) because it is hungry.
The patient ___ (die) before the doctor came.
rule: Past Perfect (happened before another past action)

sentence: The doctor came after the patient ___ (die).
We did not ___ (go) to school yesterday.
Let us ___ (go) out for a walk.

rule: Gerund as subject takes Singular Verb
Infinitive as subject takes Singular Verb
Participle used as Adjective (Subject 'stone' is singular)

sentence: By the time you reach there, I ___ (finish) the work.
rule: Future Perfect (By the time + Future action)

sentence: I ___ (live) in Dhaka for ten years.
The man was ___ (run) over by a car.
rule: Passive Voice (Past Participle of run is run)

sentence: The books which I bought ___ (be) lost.
The pen which I bought ___ (write) well.
He speaks as if he ___ (be) a foreigner.
It is many years since I ___ (come) here.
He talks as though he ___ (know) everything.

rule: See + object + base form (Completed action) or going

sentence: He went to London with a view to ___ (learn) English.
Would you mind ___ (have) a cup of tea?
I do not know where to ___ (go).
The heavy rain prevented us from ___ (go) out.
We look forward to ___ (hear) from you.
It is no use ___ (worry) about it.

rule: Yet usually takes Present Perfect Negative
Distance as a unit = Singular Verb

sentence: If I had known, I ___ (tell) you.
Had I been there, I ___ (help) him.

rule: Collective noun acting as one unit = Singular

sentence: Time and tide ___ (wait) for no one.

rule: Verb agrees with the nearest subject (I)
Verb agrees with the nearest subject (he)
